dose_adult_standard: 500mg - 1000mg, every 4 to 6 hours
usage_note: Crucial Safety Note: Only safe OTC option for fever/pain in Dengue Fever. Do not exceed 4000mg (4 grams) in 24 hours. Consult a doctor if you have liver problems.

dose_adult_standard: 200mg - 400mg, every 4 to 6 hours
usage_note: Take with food to prevent stomach upset. Do not use in Dengue Fever due to bleeding risk. Consult a doctor for chronic use.

dose_adult_standard: Initial 4mg, then 2mg after each loose stool. Maximum 8mg per day.
usage_note: Prioritize Oral Rehydration Salts (ORS). Do not use if stool is bloody or fever is high.

approved_for_symptoms: Dehydration due to Diarrhea (General, Gastroenteritis, Dengue)
dose_adult_standard: Drink slowly after each loose stool or episode of vomiting.
usage_note: Essential for rehydration. Mix with safe drinking water as directed. ORS is the primary treatment for gastroenteritis/diarrhea.

dose_adult_standard: As directed on pack (Antacids as needed, H2 Blockers once or twice daily).
usage_note: Antacids provide immediate relief. Do not take within 2 hours of other oral medications. Consult a Gastroenterologist if symptoms are chronic.

dose_adult_standard: 5-10 grams mixed with a full glass of water, 1 to 3 times daily.
usage_note: Must be taken with ample water to prevent choking or obstruction. Gradually increase dosage.

dose_adult_standard: Apply a thin layer to the affected area up to 4 times daily.
usage_note: Used short-term (max 7 days) for itching and inflammation. Pair with fiber and water to prevent straining.

dose_adult_standard: 5mg - 10mg once daily
usage_note: May cause drowsiness (especially Cetirizine). Best taken at night. For chronic allergies, pair with saline nasal rinse.

dose_adult_standard: Follow directions on the label (typically every 6-8 hours).
usage_note: Only for dry, irritating cough. Do not use for wet/chesty cough. Check for interactions with other medications.

dose_adult_standard: Follow directions on the label (typically every 4 hours).
usage_note: Helps thin mucus. Drink plenty of water to improve effectiveness. Often combined in multi-symptom cold products.

dose_adult_standard: Use as needed (e.g., 2-3 times daily).
usage_note: Non-medicated and safe for frequent use. Use distilled or previously boiled water for nasal rinses to prevent infection.

dose_adult_standard: Follow directions on the label (typically 200mg 3 times daily).
usage_note: Relieves pain but does not cure the infection. Must be taken alongside prescribed antibiotics for UTI. Turns urine bright orange/red.

dose_adult_standard: 1000 IU to 5000 IU daily (dosage must be guided by blood levels).
usage_note: Essential for calcium absorption (Osteoporosis). Consult a doctor for a blood test to determine the correct therapeutic dosage.

dose_adult_standard: 1000mg - 1200mg daily (including dietary intake).
usage_note: Should be taken in combination with Vitamin D. Take in divided doses (e.g., 500mg at a time) for better absorption.

dose_adult_standard: As directed by physician (e.g., 65mg elemental iron daily).
usage_note: Only take if deficiency is confirmed by blood test. Take with Vitamin C to increase absorption. Can cause constipation.

dose_adult_standard: 1500mg Glucosamine / 1200mg Chondroitin daily.
usage_note: Used to support joint structure. Benefits may take weeks or months to be noticeable. Not an immediate pain reliever.

dose_adult_standard: Follow directions on the product label.
usage_note: Used to help manage symptoms of an enlarged prostate. Consult a Urologist before starting, as it can mask signs of prostate cancer.

dose_adult_standard: Apply a thin layer 1-2 times daily.
usage_note: Continue application for 1-2 weeks after symptoms clear to prevent recurrence.

dose_adult_standard: Use as directed on the product label.
usage_note: Can cause dryness and sun sensitivity. Start with lower concentrations. Consult a Dermatologist if acne is severe or causing scars.

dose_adult_standard: Apply a thin layer 1-2 times daily during a flare-up.
usage_note: Use short-term only (max 7 days) to reduce inflammation. For long-term control, use thick moisturizers daily.

dose_adult_standard: 3mg - 5mg Melatonin; Diphenhydramine 25mg - 50mg.
usage_note: For short-term use only. Prioritize good sleep hygiene. Diphenhydramine can cause morning drowsiness.
